title: Embroidery: White-on-white, early–mid-16th century
medium:
Medium: cotton 
Technique: double running stitch embroidery - the second stitch sometimes twists around the first instead of aligned with it on plain weave (3 narrow strips sewn together)
description: Part of embroidered panel.  Joing of 3 pieces needle made edge, the loops of which form two bands placed edge to edge are whipped together.  Linen bobbin lace sewn to 3 edges.

tombstone.epitaph:
Embroidery: White-on-white, early–mid-16th century.
early–mid-16th century. Medium: cotton 
Technique: double running stitch embroidery - the second stitch sometimes twists around the first instead of aligned with it on plain weave (3 narrow strips sewn together). Bequest of Marian Hague. 1971-50-80.
